intro: Pentagonia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy pentagonia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five lobes, which are covered in fine, pubescent hairs. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color.
